svg.title: SVG Dragging
svg.desc:
This example shows how it is possible to enable dragging of objects within SVG. The one thing it does not address is the z-level (in a typical windowing environment, clicking on an object would bring it to the top z-level), since this was not important for my demonstration I left it out but such an effect would be achievable by removing the node from its current position then appending it to the last SVG node.
The example shows four objects, a circle, a rectangle, and two arbitrary shapes. I use custom attributes (dragx, dragy) to sidestep having to parse transformation strings during drags, this is only done once during initialization.
To use, include the dragsvg.js script, make your draggable elements have the "draggable" class and call initializeDraggableElements() at the beginning of your scripts.

path.style: fill: rgb(160, 0, 0); fill-opacity: 1; stroke: none; stroke-linejoin: bevel; stroke-opacity: 1;
fill: rgb(160, 0, 0); fill-opacity: 1; fill-rule: nonzero; stroke: none; stroke-linejoin: bevel; stroke-opacity: 1;

rect.style: opacity: 0.25; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0); fill-opacity: 1; fill-rule: nonzero; stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 0.863079; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: round; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-dashoffset: 0pt; stroke-opacity: 1;

fill: url(#linearGradient5737) rgb(0, 0, 0); fill-opacity: 1; fill-rule: nonzero; stroke: rgb(200, 70, 0); stroke-width: 0.863079; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: round; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-dashoffset: 0pt; stroke-opacity: 1;

path.style: fill: rgb(200, 70, 0); fill-opacity: 1; fill-rule: nonzero; stroke: rgb(200, 70, 0); stroke-width: 0pt; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: round; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-dashoffset: 0pt; stroke-opacity: 1;

fill: rgb(255, 255, 255); fill-opacity: 1; fill-rule: nonzero; stroke: rgb(200, 70, 0); stroke-width: 0pt; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: round; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-dashoffset: 0pt; stroke-opacity: 1;

fill: none; fill-opacity: 0.75; fill-rule: evenodd; stroke: rgb(200, 70, 0); stroke-width: 1.03652; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: miter; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-opacity: 1;

fill: none; fill-opacity: 0.75; fill-rule: evenodd; stroke: rgb(255, 255, 255); stroke-width: 1.24722; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: miter; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-opacity: 1;

fill: none; fill-opacity: 0.75; fill-rule: evenodd; stroke: rgb(200, 70, 0); stroke-width: 1.11884; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: miter; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-opacity: 1;

fill: none; fill-opacity: 0.75; fill-rule: evenodd; stroke: rgb(255, 255, 255); stroke-width: 1.24722; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: miter; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-opacity: 1;

fill: none; fill-opacity: 1; fill-rule: nonzero; stroke: rgb(200, 70, 0); stroke-width: 0pt; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: round; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-dashoffset: 0pt; stroke-opacity: 1;

fill: none; fill-opacity: 1; fill-rule: nonzero; stroke: rgb(200, 70, 0); stroke-width: 0pt; stroke-linecap: butt; stroke-linejoin: round; stroke-miterlimit: 4; stroke-dasharray: none; stroke-dashoffset: 0pt; stroke-opacity: 1;
